results.title: In My Room
results.brief_description: Being a teenager is hell. But in your private space, your bedroom, you can be yourself. In My Room enters the bedrooms of three teenagers: Kristy, a 17 year old who lives with her mum in a St. Kilda flat; Will, a 16 year old, boarding in a room with three other boys at Melbourne Grammar; and Jyka, a 14 year old Koorie who lives with his family in Broadmeadows. This film tells the story of their private places, filled with possessions that represent their past and future and the changing perspectives and passions affecting their lives.

results.title: In continuo
results.brief_description: The film begins with a woman scrubbing a wall. Very soon, as burly men put on their white aprons, we realise that we are inside the world of the abattoir. Wordlessly the men begin to sharpen their knifes and their hatchets. The soundtrack is the music of the abattoir floor. We see none of the slaughter but we see the after-effects of the butchery and we hear the sounds of death. Finally, we see the blood and waste seep into the earth and we are left to contemplate the brutality of something called civilisation.

results.title: In a rehearsal room
results.creator_credit: David W. Hahn and Otter Productions
results.brief_description: In Paris, at the turn of the century, two young dancers meet in a rehearsal room. Warming up, each is very aware of the other. Tentatively they come together and then, caught up in the music, they dance. A blend of ballet, music and romance.

results.title: Impudence does not pay
results.creator_credit: Bruno I. Botige and Progress Film
results.brief_description: A black and white silhouette film for children telling the story of a gorilla who steals his hunter’s rifle and helmet, after an exciting episode, and then taunts the other animals, even riding on a lion’s back. Finally they can bear it no longer and toss him from his hammock into the open jaws of a crocodile Music only

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: Henri Lacam, Jacques Armand Cardon and International Film Promotions
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henri Lacam, Jacques Armand Cardon and International Film Promotions

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.brief_description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.

results.title: Impression of Oakleigh Technical School. . a caring place
results.brief_description: An overview of Oakleigh Technical School as seen throught the eyes of Scott, one of the students. The school is show as having a vibrant school council with an innovative, stimulating program.

results.title: Impossible jump
results.brief_description: Can an Elephant jump? Watch it try as it avoids the deadly spears as it gathers the keys to get to the next level.

results.title: Imperial city
results.creator_credit: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: In 1911, the British built a new capital for India. The creation of New Delhi was the greatest artistic enterprise of the British Empire, and we follow the architects in a search for a style incorporating British and Indian architecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films
